title: Kash Patel
added: In February 2020, Patel was part of Donald Trump's entourage during the state visit of the United States to the Republic of India and was noted in press reports as one of two Americans of Indian descent to accompany the president.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Roy |first1=Shubhajit |title=Trump’s visit: Two Indian-Americans part of US President’s 16-member delegation |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/india/trumps-visit-two-indian-americans-part-of-us-presidents-16-member-delagation-6281799/ |access-date=January 2, 2021 |work=India Abroad |date=February 23, 2020}}</ref><ref name="ectimes">{{cite news |last1=Duttagupta |first1=Ishani |title=US President’s delegation to India may include several Indian American officials |url=https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/us-presidents-delegation-to-india-may-include-several-indian-american-officials/articleshow/74153326.cms?from=mdr |access-date=January 2, 2021 |work=[[Economic Times]] |date=February 15, 2020}}</ref>{{efn|The other was [[Ajit Pai]].<ref name="ectimes"/>}}

title: Kash Patel
deleted: Defense and intelligence officials have characterized Patel's appointment as a threat to the security of the United States. After the [[storming of the United States Capitol]], former NSC advisor [[Fiona Hill (presidential advisor)|Fiona Hill]] suggested that Patel and other recent Pentagon appointees may have been involved in staging a "coup" against the United States government.

<ref>{{cite news |title=Trump Officials Rush to Keep Him From Sparking Another Conflict — at Home or Abroad |url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/after-capitol-riot-trump-officials-rush-to-keep-him-from-sparking-another-conflictat-home-or-abroad |access-date=January 9, 2021 |work=[[Daily Beast]] |date=January 7, 2021}}</ref>

title: Kash Patel
deleted: Kash Patel is a MyPillow advocate, remarking how it has changed his life in more ways than one. Most recently, his lord and daddy, Michael Lindell secretly named him as America’s 2021 next top Insurrectionist (as seen when Lindell exited the White House on 1/15 following a meeting with President Trump), to which Patel remarked “I am so honored to help overthrow the American government, and get a great nights sleep while doing so”.

title: Kash Patel
added: [[Axios]] reported, in January 2021, that Patel had been considered for appointment as [[Director of the Central Intelligence Agency|Acting Director of the Central Intelligence Agency]] by Trump to replace [[Gina Haspel]].<ref name="vf"/><ref name="swan1">{{cite news |last1=Swan |first1=Jonathan |title=Episode 5: The secret CIA plan |url=https://www.axios.com/off-the-rails-trump-cia-kash-patel-6c5ea317-43e9-48da-993f-5c7ab823c4c1.html |access-date=January 23, 2021 |work=[[Axios]] |date=January 18, 2021}}</ref>

According to Axios, Patel was to be appointed [[Deputy Director of the Central Intelligence Agency]] immediately prior to a planned dismissal of Haspel, allowing him to then head the agency in an acting capacity.<ref name="vf"/><ref name="swan1"/> In an interview with ''Vanity Fair'', Ezra Cohen-Watnick confirmed portions of the Axios report while Patel declined to comment one way or the other.<ref name="vf"/><ref name="swan1"/>
